# Anatomy of a Quarto Document

## Basic Components{.smaller}

:::{layout-ncol="2"}


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
````
---
title: "Anatomy of a Quarto Document"
---

## R

```{r}
head(mtcars)
```

## STATA

```stata
version 13
use censas
tabulate region
summarize marriage_rate divorce_rate median_age if state!="Nevada"
```

The script above is from the [Section 16.1](https://www.stata.com/manuals13/u16.pdf) of the *Stata 13 Manual*
````
:::
:::



- An (optional) **YAML header** between `---` lines.
- Chunks of code between ```` ``` ````.
- Text mixed with markdown formatting
:::

## YAML

::: incremental
- An (optional) **YAML header** between `---` lines.
- If missing, Quarto defaults apply.
- Control whole document options
- Available options differ by format:
  - HTML
  - PDF
  - Websites
:::

## Code Blocks

::: incremental
- Chunks of code between ```` ``` ````s.
- Executable R/python/Julia code starts with: ```` ```{r} ```` 
- Syntax highlighting for [~140 Languages](https://github.com/jgm/skylighting/tree/master/skylighting-core/xml): ```` ```stata ````
:::

## Markdown Text

- Simple text formatting:
  - `# Heading`
  - `_italics_`, `**bold**`, ``` `code` ```
  - `[linked phrase](http://example.com)`

# Quarto Formats
